body.name: AIRMSEN AE-TDQR03 Portable Countertop Dishwasher, Compact Mini Dish Washer with 5-Liter Built-in Water Tank and Air-Dry Function, 5 Washing Programs, Baby Care, Glass & Fruit Wash-White/Black
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery Tuesday, February 20. Order within 11 hrs 18 mins
features: AE-TDQR03 Countertop Dishwasher with upper and lower rotating spray arms provide corner to corner coverage, washing temperature range: 122℉-167℉, thoroughly dissolve grease stains, transforming crusty, greasy, or messy dishes into clean, ready-to-use place settings. In addition, compared with manual dishwashing, this dishwasher uses only 1.3 gal of water, which reduces water consumption by 80%. It also only consumes 0.135-0.439 kWh of electricity per cycle and saves floor space.

Dimensions: Product Depth: 16.75" | Product Height: 18.05" | Product Width: 16.86" | Product Weight: 26.46 lbs | Noise level: 50.2dB. With the portability of a countertop dishwasher, you can move it into a RV, boat or cabin in the woods. Pick up your portable countertop dishwasher and take it with you.

Capacity: Four (4) standard place setting capacity can fit a variety of dishes (up to 12-inches in diameter at an angle, up to 10.25-inches when upright) - Includes dish rack, cup shelf, cutlery basket and fruit basket. Meet daily needs.

Water Source: Kitchen Sink (Faucet) Hookup or Built-in Separate Water Tank. The water tank is a great option if you have difficulty attaching and securing water hoses, or if you want to wash dishes far from a sink. Water hose is included for a direct water hookup to kitchen faucet (may need to use adapter).

Five Washing Cycle: Normal, Speed[29 min], Glass, Baby Care, Fruit. The minimalistic and straightforward interface allows you to effortlessly navigate the different settings to suit your dish washing needs.

Extra-Drying Function: Provide 60 minutes of hot air drying and 72 hours automatic ventilation to keep your dishes clean, prevent odors and dry for long periods. This mode can be used with any washing mode other than FRUIT mode and can also be turned on separately.

Steam Cleaning: Baby care(Heavy) mode will perform 4 alternate washing cycles of cold and hot water. The steam generated by the water temperature of 167℉ can deeply clean baby bottles, toys and heavily soiled dishes, and make your glassware sparkling.

Practical Design: LED touch screen display is angled to face you, increasing visibility and ease of use. The transparent dual-layer glass door, combined with a built-in LED lamp so that you can watch the food stains get cleaned off your dishes in real time.
Quality Control Note: All Airmsen dishwashers are manufacturer tested to ensure proper operation, so a small amount of residual water in the unit is normal.
Detergents: Pods, liquid, or powder dishwasher detergent are all acceptable. It's recommended to only use detergent tablets when running long cycles so the tablets fully dissolve.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Why Choose AIRMSEN Previous page Next page

Complete Portable Countertop Dishwasher A small kitchen doesn't mean you're destined to wash dishes by hand. Lucky for you, AIRMSEN AE-TDQR03 Countertop Dishwasher is just over 18 inches tall, and come with a variety of features including an dry mode and tabletop design. This machine comes with hoses to connect it to the kitchen faucet but what sets it apart is its built-in five-liter water tank, so it can be operated without tying up your faucet. After installing one in your space, you’ll be treated to sparkly pots and grime-free spoons regularly. Countertop Portable Dishwasher This diswasher is life changing. Don't missing time with family and friends because of dishes. Save water, time, cleanliness.
About AIRMSEN Previous page Next page

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 9, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great little dish washer!
reviews.reviewText: I don't have a large kitchen in my 1800s farmhouse and didn't want to give up cupboard space to install a full sized dishwasher. With just the two of us we decided to try a counter sized. This is perfect! Easy to set up and does a great job. I'm surprised how much I can put in this and everything comes out sparkling clean. This is it's first week so I'll update later. Also love how easy this is to use. This would be great for the elderly for this reason.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 11, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Voted Top 10 Best Countertop Dishwasher (Remedy for Upper Spray Arm Also Included in Post)
reviews.reviewText: AIRMSEN Portable Countertop Dishwasher is a great choice for any small kitchen or apartment. It's lightweight and easy to use and it can easily fit on the countertop or in a cupboard. The dishwashing cycles are powerful and efficient. This dishwasher is an ideal option for anyone who wants to save time and energy when washing dishes. Not to mention, it has an affordable price tag that will fit into anyone's budget. I don't know why I didn't buy this 5 years ago when I moved into my apartment that did not have a dishwasher.****Note For Anyone Experiencing The Following Problem: Upper Spray Arm Not Turning****So I started experiencing a slight problem about 3-4 months into using the dishwasher. The upper spray arm would stop rotating during the cleaning cycle. I emailed the company and they offered the following remedy:The most common culprit as to why the upper spray arm isn't moving is that debris has built up within the inner workings of the upper spray arm. To fix this, remove the lower tray of the dishwasher to freely access the upper spray arm. Then remove the upper spray arm by turning the large screw by hand. After it's removed, clean out any debris that has wrapped around the mounting area for the spray arm. This is usually food particles, hair, and other general buildup. Then check the spout nozzles for any blockages. Use a toothpick or a sharp stick to unclog the individual outlets. Then rinse with water to clean out the dirty things in the spouts. Make sure that each outlet is not clogged and re-install the spray arm using the large screw. Please note that the spouts must be facing down. After installation, first manually rotate the spray arm by pushing the upper spray arm with your finger to check whether it runs smoothly. If it runs smoothly, then the problem is solved.THIS FIXED THE PROBLEM FOR ME! Try this remedy first. If you clean up the upper spray arm and it's still not rotating, contact the company directly on the Airmsen website and report the issue using the form on the Contact US page. I hope this helps.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 18, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars WOW!! LIFE CHANGING! ❤️
reviews.reviewText: So I did a lot of research before pulling the trigger on this countertop dishwasher. This one had the best reviews, price and quick delivery. It’s pretty big and barely fits under the cabinet so I do have to pull it forward to add the water with the pitcher. It’s crazy how many dishes fit! Almost a whole sink of basic dishware . This has made life easier and I’m using soooo much less water than hand washing. Uses dish detergent liquid or pods. I use liquid and the glasses are spotty but I don’t care cause I love this machine. The dishes come out clean and dry. I bought this dishwasher, it wasn’t a freebee.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 9, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Works as advertised. Impressive little machine.
reviews.reviewText: Delivery was quick and packaged securely. Out of the box and unpacked in three minutes. READ THE ENCLOSED DIRECTIONS. This older home needs a kitchen makeover, so in the meantime picked this up. Only two of us here, and this works perfectly. Have had it a couple of weeks and run it one daily before bed. Have been using the SPEED function, and the dishes, silver ware, cups, come out spotless. Was easy to hook up the drain hose and drape it into the sink. It runs quietly and efficiently using Cascade gel. Just make sure you have adequate space on your countertop. The dimensions are in the product description. Perfect for a vacation home, a rv, or even in this case for a single family home that needed a dishwasher in a pinch. Compared lots of different portable dishwashers and glad I chose this one. I highly recommend this dishwasher. Great value for the money.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 8, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Incredible little dishwasher, with one weakness
reviews.reviewText: I got this dishwasher for my dry yurt. I have to haul the water, but it uses far less water than running them under a sink. Since I don't have running water, it's difficult for me to rinse my dishes off very well before putting them in the washer. So I have probably pushed this washer to its limit.It does an incredible job on caked-on food, really greasy dishes, and can be loaded very full lol. I have really put this thing through its paces.I've had it for about 3 months with no issues until recently. I did not rinse out my French press well enough, and the coffee grounds clogged a lot of the spouts. This caused water pressure issues and neither arm was spinning. But all it took was detaching and rinsing the arms out mid-cycle, along with cleaning the filter, and it is now working good as new! Luckily I had seen a previous review before I bought it talking about how the dry granulated dishwashing powder caused a similar issue. So I'd recommend a liquid detergent and just be ready for some maintenance cleaning (which I should be doing anyway).I highly recommend this washer for dry cabins/yurts/rvs etc. It saves me hours of time, and gets everything super clean. 10/10 would recommend (without coffee grounds).

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 6, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great for our RV
reviews.reviewText: Super quiet and holds a lot of dishes.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 16, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Not a kiddie dishwasher!!
reviews.reviewText: I was afraid this would be to dishwashers what the EZ-Bake Oven is to ranges, but it is an effective kitchen appliance! Size and weight wise it's a bit like the old portable televisions- a bulky square. I bought a stainless steel kitchen cart here on Amazon by Amgood that is 18" square and the height including the wheels on the bottom is an inch or two above the countertops so it's easy to roll over to the sink and gravity drain into it. Filling with the pitcher is easy and the hose easily drapes into the sink. So relieved the days of endless handwashing are over! Highly recommend!!P.S. Using Seventh Generation Dishwasher Packs (powder in pods) have been working great- usually use the Speed wash setting with major food bits wiped off beforehand.

reviews.reviewTitle: Wish I had got this years ago
reviews.reviewText: I am so happy with this purchase. I debated for so long about whether to get a countertop dishwasher-would it be worth it for the smaller amount it could hold? Would I regret losing the countertop space? Would I hate the way it looked in my small kitchen? Etc. In the end, my biggest regret is that I didn’t get one years ago. I’ve had this for almost two months now and can’t remember how I managed without it for the last 6 years. I use it at least once a day, sometimes twice and have not had any issues with the machine. It was easy to set up - but quite heavy to carry up the stairs and get up on the counter -fyi. I rinse the dishes well before putting them in and they come out perfectly clean. As recommended by other reviewers, I also use liquid dishwasher soap and havnt had any issues with the arms clogging from undiscovered soap. The machine is fairly quiet - my living room and kitchen are basically one room and I don’t need to turn up the tv volume when this is on. Size-wise, it can fit a lot. Though it takes some trial and error with your dishes to get the best pattern for loading it right. My plates are slightly larger than 10 inches and they don’t fit neatly in the designated spot, bit by leaning them the opposite way I’ve figured out how to get at least 2-3 in there. Honestly, this thing saves me so much time and I’m never stressed about the piles of dirty dishes that used to pile up in my tiny sink every day. If you are debating getting one, do it.

Positiv:- bei einem 2-Personen-Haushalt läuft die Maschine jeden 2-3 Tag und bis auf Töpfe, Pfannen und Zeller über 26cm passt eigentlich immer alles rein. Die 26cm-Teller muss man aber in den 2 und 3 Schlitz stellen. Am Rand und direkt unter die obere Wasserdüse passen sie nicht. Hier muss man aber auch sagen, wer 3mal täglich isst und dabei jedesmal dreckiges Geschirr hat, da kann es sein, dass man täglich spülen müsste.- Man kann die Maschine irgendwo in der Küche oder auch im Bad (je nach Platz) aufstellen, da man durch den Wassertank sehr unabhängig ist. Ich z.B. Stelle einfach eine große Schüssel unter den Wasserablaufschlauch und lasse das verbrauchte Wasser reinlaufen, da ich direkt neben der Spüle keine Abstellmöglichkeit habe.- durch den Wassertank weiß ich genau welche Wassermenge verbraucht wird und gerade, wenn man etwas umweltbewusster agieren will, sind ca. 5,7 Liter weniger als man bei einem Abwasch per Hand braucht.- die Lautstärke entspricht meiner Meinung nach in etwas der einer großen Geschirrspülmaschine. Ich empfinde das Geräusch nicht als störend.- nach ca. 3 Wochen Gebrauch bisher keine Mängel festgestellt.- Von der Sauberkeit her ist auch kein Unterschied zu einer großen Maschine festzustellen und ich wasche das Geschirr vorher nicht wirklich vor um es dann fast sauber in die Maschine zu stellen. ÄNegativ:- für den Preis könnte man sich auch eine größere Maschine holen (bei genügend vorhandenem Platz und der Möglichkeit eines Anschlusses), aber da muss man dann auch den höheren Wasser-und Stromverbrauch mit einrechnen ( also ist das eigentlich kein wirklich negativer Punkt!)Fazit:Ich würde mir die Maschine bisher wieder holen!

I LOVE this countertop dishwasher! Works so well and saves me so much time, now that I don’t have to wash each and every bowl, plate, and utensil by hand! I have 7 detailed tips below, but here’s the “too long didn’t read version” if you’re pressed for time:TLDR: 1-Use gel dishwasher detergent NOT powdered!2-Do not use dishwasher detergent pods—they’re way too large for these small units!3-Rinse well everything you put into this dishwasher! Plates with sticky or dried-on foods or knives with a layer of Mayonnaise still on them may not come completely clean.4-Clean the filter (rinse it) and wipe the unit out regularly with a damp cloth.5-If the top piece of the silverware basket is being a pain, you can remove it—it really doesn’t make much of a difference in how well your silverware gets cleaned.6-If you are able to hook up the supplied hose to your kitchen faucet, do that instead of using the supplied jug to fill the unit with water. It saves time.7-Register your product on Airmsen’s website and they’ll approve you for a 1-year warranty (Amazon gives a 30-day warranty).Now, here’s the detailed version of the tips that have helped me in my 2-month relationship with this dishwasher—he treats me so well! Yes it’s a “he” ;)1-He’s happier with gel detergent than with powdered detergent. The manual says that powdered or gel detergent can be used, but that’s not true at all! The powder detergent has small granules that cause his spray arms to get stuck so they stop spinning. If you don’t catch this, he won’t clean your dishes properly for you. You can fix him by manually spinning his arms a few times until you’re confident he can spin them continuously on his own for the rest of the cycle, but this is such a pain and makes him out to be pretty high-maintenance! You get the detergent water all over your hands (not good) and you can’t just start the cycle and walk away cuz you have to babysit him for the first few minutes! If you already have the powdered detergent it’s not the end of the world. Just stir a Tablespoon (and no more) of the powder into a cup of hot tap water before adding it to his main compartment (make sure to pour it into his main compartment NOT into his top water tank AND, wait until he’s drained before adding the detergent—he drains at the start of every cycle). Unfortunately, I bought powdered detergent for him when I first bought him. He didn’t like that so he made me dissolve it in water for each load, but that got old really fast, especially when I was in a hurry! So I went and bought him some gel detergent and since then, he’s been much happier and so have I! Learn from my mistake and you’ll be thankful you did. ;)2-He also doesn’t like dishwasher detergent pods. They’re way too much detergent for him at once and he likely won’t be able to completely dissolve it by the end of his cycle. The detergent holder at the bottom of his door holds about 1 tablespoon of detergent, which is all he needs to wash my dishes perfectly. ;) This is a case of less is more!3-He loves it when I rinse my dishes, silverware and utensils really well. While he works really great, he just doesn’t have the same washing capability as his older brother, the standard home dishwasher (sorry to say buddy), so he can’t reach as many nooks and crannies. Thick layers of grease or sauces, stuck/dried on food particles, and any food particles in general likely won’t be washed off completely. Tip: rinse dishes, silverware and utensils as soon as you’re done with them or leave them to soak if you won’t be putting a load of dishes on right away. This has saved me lots of time and elbow grease! ;)4-Make sure to clean his filter and give him a sponge bath regularly. Every 1-2 loads for his filter and every 3-5 loads for sponge baths. The less gunk in his filter, the easier it is to clean. And, I wasn’t cleaning him as often as I should have and I’ve noticed he has hard water deposits now.5-Sometimes I take away the top piece of his silverware basket if it’s being bad. It’s not always needed and it detaches from the basket base far too easily. Besides, I don’t find it makes a huge difference in how well this guy’s able to clean my silverware—he makes it squeaky clean every time with or without that top piece, and I usually have a good amount of silverware in each load (at least 7 pieces).6-If I had the option to hook up the hose that came in his box to my kitchen faucet, I would much prefer to do that vs using the jug that also came with him. He’s pretty thirsty and using a jug to quench his thirst can be a bit of a pain, but he’s worth it I suppose. ;)7-I’ve registered him on the Airmsen website. Airmsen offers a 1-year warranty, while Amazon offers a 30-day warranty. It’s definitely worth it if he breaks after the 30 days! I hope he doesn’t though, cuz he’s the best relationship (aka purchase) I’ve ever had—hands down! ;)Hope these tips helped you and if they did, please mark my review as helpful! I’ll be sure to add more tips I learn along the way in my relationship with this special guy! ;) Thanks for reading! :)

Bought this for my small apartment that does not have room to add an instal a regular dishwasher.This one works very well. The dishes are clean, and although you have to play a bit of Tetris with your dishes, you can fit a good amount in the rack. Couple things to note:- The water tank needs 5L of water to function; they provide a measuring mug, but the appliance also lets you know when more water is need/enough was added.- The spinning jets are mechanical, meaning they turn with the water pressure. I’ve noticed that the top one doesn’t always turn properly, but I think the fix is to make sure it is tightened well enough so the water doesn’t seep out of the connection.Overall, perfect for small spaces, and singles/couples.

reviews.reviewTitle: Nach nicht mal 1 Jahr kaputt und der Support ignoriert meine E-Mail
reviews.reviewText: War eigentlich ein gutes Gerät außer die wirklich minimale Dauer, die das Gerät gehalten hat !!!
